Description: Attic black-glazed pottery small bowl or salt cellar with incurving rim and ring foot. Glazed save for underside of foot reserved, with two circles.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Spurlock Museum, University of Illinois. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Published in S.U. Wisseman, CVA World Heritage Museum, College of Liberal Arts and Sciences Krannert Art Museum, College of Fine and Applied Arts I (USA 24), 1989, p. 32, pl. 35.1. Compare Spurlock Museum 1912.01.0023 and 1912.01.0024; Royal Ontario Museum 919.5.71 (Hayes, Greek and Italian Black-gloss Wares and Related Wares in the Royal Ontario Museum, 1984. Pp. 40-41, no. 66, with additional comparanda); Copenhagen 7626 (Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Copenhague 4 [Danemark 4], p. 140, pl. 179 : 4); Copenhagen 7625, 478 (ibid., p. 139, pl. 177 : 9-10) and Agora P 8950 (Sparkes and Talcott, The Athenian Agora vol. 12: Black and Plain Pottery of the 6th, 5th, and 4th Centuries B.C., 1970, pp. 133-134, 297, no. 850, pl. 33).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1814)
